website_summaries.verdict: An ideal gift for a college student living on their own for the first time.
pros: The size of the bowl is close to the size of bowl you would get at a standard ice cream shop
The maker itself is extremely lightweight and simple to clean
Would make a much-appreciated addition to any dorm room
You can put tortillas in this waffle maker to spice up your taco night
Included recipe book is full of ideas
cons: Getting the exact right amount of batter is necessary
Too little and the waffle is too thin, too much and the machine overflows

website_summaries.verdict: Compact, stylish, and easy to use, this model is fantastic for quickly making crispy and delicious waffle bowls to cradle your favorite ice cream.
pros: Makes a pair of waffle ice cream bowls at once
Available in aqua, red, and pink
cons: Crafting the perfect waffle bowl may be a learning process

website_summaries.verdict: Terrific for making unique breakfast waffle bowls to fill with whatever you wish. Also makes taco bowls.
pros: younger kids will enjoy using the appliance
Cleaning it is easy as it's nonstick
The right size for dorms, camping, and apartments, as well as regular kitchens
cons: May have to watch how much batter you use as it could end up overflowing
Produces bowls that are smaller than some users may want

customer_reviews.title: Gluten free waffle cones, YES!
customer_reviews.text: I never knew I needed this little appliance until I tried it. (And it is little!) I have been 100% gluten free for 10 years or so for health reasons, and I really miss having waffle cones with my ice cream. Well, I miss it no longer. This magical device heats up quickly and converts GF waffle/pancake mix (I use the Hungry Jack brand mix with sprinkles) into a hot, crispy, wonderful waffle bowl. My only complaint is that it doesn’t have a switch or slider to adjust heat/doneness, so you just have to use trial and error to determine how long to leave the bowl cooking for. But this is not bad enough to reduce my 5-Star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Sky

customer_reviews.title: This thing stinks!
customer_reviews.text: the products works fine, I have made tortilla bowls and bacon bowls (which was a huge greasy mess) but it smells bad. I have noticed with a lot of newer non stick pans, they have a plasticy chemical smells once they heat up and no amount of washing will get rid of it. That is what this smells like too, so although it works fine, I probably won't use it often, if at all.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I have finally used my waffle bowl maker and it's great. I did not care for the receipes that came with it. But the bowls are perfect. I want my bowls to be hard so I will cook them for 4-5 minutes. I think that I will use my maker in many occasions!
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Forney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Chaffle bowls!
customer_reviews.text: I love my waffle bowl maker, it’s easy to use and easy to clean. Small and compact, easy to store. Looking forward so making keto waffles.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetie3205

customer_reviews.title: Quick fast / great breakfast.
customer_reviews.text: I am not the biggest breakfast person, but I live this machine. Making a waffle bowl filled with fruit is a great way to start your morning. The color goes great in our kitchen. And we have used this guy for quite a few breakfasts now. Many ways to use this, but so far waffle bowls are my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Scott brown

customer_reviews.title: Delightful!! Absolute awesome product. Foolproof and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: What an absolute delight this little machine is! It’s super easy to operate, clean, and comes with a fantastic little recipe book. FYI-the original waffle recipe in the beginning of the recipe section of the book makes about 10.
customer_reviews.author: JACinFL

customer_reviews.title: It's so simple and easy to use, you can teach the kids how to use it.
customer_reviews.text: It overflowed on me at first, got it right on the third try. I also made the batter a little thicker and I peeked about three times until I got an almost perfect bowl. I'm using butter flavored cooking spray so there's no chance of sticking. You can be as creative as you like with what do you put in it. The scrambled eggs and cheese with sausage, hash browns (cooked on my Dash DMG8100RD 8” Express Electric Round Griddle (whew, that's a mouthfull... get it? Mouthfull... no?) Anyways buy it you're gonna love it.
customer_reviews.author: billy

customer_reviews.title: Tasty chaffle bowls
customer_reviews.text: First thing I made with this bad boy was a chaffle taco bowl. Did not disappoint! Nice and crispy. Cant wait to make ice cream bowls with it with some rebel icecream. Yum 😋
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Geddes

customer_reviews.title: Desert time!!
customer_reviews.text: Makes for a cute way to have a desert or fruit bowl in the morning for breakfast, and I'll be trying a tortilla wrap in it to see if I can make a taco bowl like in a restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: JMCar

customer_reviews.title: still overflowed
customer_reviews.text: Just takes some time and patience to figure out BUT WELL WORTH IT!!! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Abbe

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: I love this idea. I made them this morning. Nothing wrong with this product and the waffles come out very evenly cooked, but the waffles don't stay crispy more than about 1/2 hr. So, if you are going to make them, make them at the last minute. I put cinnamon in the batter for ice cream and hot fudge -- yum!
customer_reviews.author: Joanmcq

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to get the hang of, but really cool
customer_reviews.text: My first attempt to cook with this was interesting. The first waffle oozed out of the side and all over the place. I'd added exactly a half a cup so I added a bit less and that seemed to work. Getting the hang of how long to cook each waffle is challenging but after a few raw ones and a few over cooked ones I did get some good ones. I'm excited to try other recipes and perfect the waffles so I can make this more often because it did cook really fast and both me and the kids loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Petty

customer_reviews.title: I found out that if you place the waffle bowls outside they are crunchy
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this waffle maker. It was simple to use and made great waffle bowls
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth green

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second DASH item I have and I love this! I made a taco bowl by modifying one of the recipes that came with the unit so that it was Plant Paradox compliant. Bowls popped out with no fuss. My recipe: 3/4 C organic toasted millet flour, 1/2 C almond flour, 1 tsp monk fruit sugar substitute, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp ground coriander, 1/2 tsp smoked paprika, 1 cup buttermilk or coconut milk, 1 egg, 3 TBS imported melted butter, 1 C Gruyere cheese.
customer_reviews.author: ephraim taylor

customer_reviews.title: Makes great waffles and other edible bowls
customer_reviews.text: I got one for myself and loved it so much I got them as gifts. So far, everyone loves theirs as much as I love mine. I like the waffles best but it’s nice to be able to make a variety of edible bowls.
customer_reviews.author: S Force

customer_reviews.title: Such ana amazing waffle bowl maker
customer_reviews.text: Such ana amazing waffle bowl maker! I did use less then 1/4 cup of waffle liquid because the first time it spill a lot on one side of the waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Magdalena

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: We also put tortillas in them and make little taco bowls
customer_reviews.author: BalMur Delta Services

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy edible bowls
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is so much fun to bring uniqueness to same old meals, so far I have made standard waffle bowls for ice cream and I've also made hash brown breakfast bowls for eggs and bacon- both were hit.
customer_reviews.author: SulliRam67

customer_reviews.title: Best Father’s Day gift!
customer_reviews.text: Great waffles and great recipes. Bad for my diet, but awesome for my soul.
customer_reviews.author: Magareeshi

customer_reviews.title: Great Present for X-mas
customer_reviews.text: Purchased several of these (one for us and another for next christmas (or a present for a birthday if we get caught without a present). Great novelty product that beyond occasional use, I don't see sitting on the counter. We're not going to be making weekly Wafflle bowls but perhaps several times a year we'll pull it out.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: it was fun to use and then eat my creation
customer_reviews.text: I unboxed the waffle maker this afternoon and immediately whipped up a batch of Keto waffle batter. The batter consisted of Green Banana flour, eggs, cream cheese a little water and baking powder. As soon as the iron was hot I started making waffle cups. I filled the cups with a mixture of creme fraise blueberries and some blueberry jam. so much fun to make and eat, I've already recommended the waffle maker to my sister. The iron is well built and heats up quickly. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James O. Becroft

customer_reviews.title: Can't really wash this...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say not to immerse. While I expected that, just wiping off a non-stick surface just doesn't seem clean enough. I wipe out with detergent and then go back with a wet cloth to rinse. A little bit more maintenance than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: B. S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Love this little thing
customer_reviews.text: had to play with the cooking times.. I started off with 5 minutes per the instructions and tried one with four minutes than 3 finally got it down to 2 minutes which seems to be perfect for this area. also made some waffle bowls out of gingerbread mix those took 3 minutes.. put some Vanilla ice-cream in them with crushed peppermint candys.. that was our Christmas dessert. Plan on using this for many other things, like using a bread mix and putting spiced apples in the middle. or trying chocolate with cherries. for valentines day.. truly a versitle little Machine.. glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Holly J. Mattson

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Makes Great Keto Taco Salad Bowls
customer_reviews.text: Love this little waffle bowl maker. Use to make chaffle taco salad bowls.
customer_reviews.author: In Search of the Truth

customer_reviews.title: does as promised
customer_reviews.text: Living the Keto lifestyle, I thought this might help give me back taco salads, and I was right. The small portion is perfect, and it cooks in mere minutes. Clean up is a breeze, too.
customer_reviews.author: Janice M. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS!
customer_reviews.text: Makes delicious Low Carb / Keto snacks and wraps. Easy to clean and stores nicely when not in use. Made golden breakfast bowls and crispy mozzarella crisps (1 Bel Gioioso mini pack per crisp) in less than 3 minutes each. Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Marianne W.

customer_reviews.title: Chaffle bowls!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I've made ice cream bowls, taco bowls and soup bowls
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Cute, small waffle bowl maker
customer_reviews.text: Nice size. Still working on a perfect recipe. The ones included are okay. Took almost 5 minutes a bowl and made 10 bowls. Dad was excited to make these the first time but I did feel bad that he was tied to it that long.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Jones

customer_reviews.title: Niche product but cool.
customer_reviews.text: Filling fresh waffle bowls with delicious treats ... Good idea? Depends on your diet. (LOL) The Machine works well, non stick, just be careful not to scratch the coatings.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Hallberg

customer_reviews.title: CHOCOLATE CHIPS!!!
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend really likes it. Watch the amount, it will spill. Blueberries in the batter seem to be ok. It’s easy to use. Add some chocolate chips for best results.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Fun! Recipes that came with it are pretty good ...
customer_reviews.text: Fun! Recipes that came with it are pretty good so far. We've used it a half dozen times so far and it's been great. Drawback is that the timing needs to be done with an external timer...too much and they are ruined.
customer_reviews.author: UseItUpWearItOut

customer_reviews.title: Makes fun waffles
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a young adult friend. They loved it. The waffles looked good in the pictures I saw. They saw lots of options to be creative.
customer_reviews.author: Hecetamom

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! This is my new favorite kitchen gadget. I bought the pink one, and even my husband loves it! It’s so easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Keto
customer_reviews.text: Great for Keto chaffles. Savory or sweet. My personal fave is an ice cream bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Cptjer

customer_reviews.title: Too HOT to handle!
customer_reviews.text: My first time using the waffle bowl maker today was difficult. The handle got ridiculously hot. Using a hot pad to unclip the closure and raise the lid was tough to do. With one gloved hand and a towel in my other hand, I managed to open the bowl maker. After three attempts, I finished the rest of the batter in my regular waffle iron. I plan to make hash brown bowls one day later this week. If that is just as difficult, I'm trashing this item. Being easy to clean means nothing to me if it's this difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K. ellis

customer_reviews.title: DASH Waffle Bowl Maker review
customer_reviews.text: The DASH Waffle Bowl Maker is a handy gadget to have. It's easy to clean and store. I've had no problems with sticking so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Darling!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, love the size. I love making it to make taco bowls and ice cream bowls.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: My kids will eat their breakfast! I now make a healthy waffle bowl with fruit and yougart and they love eating the bowl!

customer_reviews.title: Got a dud?
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice and it died. Now have to send back to mfr.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I make low carb waffles in this love love love
customer_reviews.author: spoolsd29

customer_reviews.title: Grandkids LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for each of my kid’s homes for my grandchildren. We all love it! Crisp, delicious waffle bowls and super crispy tortilla bowls. The littles think they are having something special when it’s a “bowl” that they made themselves. Tip...use less waffle batter than it says to prevent overflowing. Easy clean up!
customer_reviews.author: AlohaGrama

customer_reviews.title: Nice, for one or two peeps
customer_reviews.text: I'll do keto so I make chaffles, egg and Moz cheese waffles carb free. I made some keto ice cream bowls for keto ice cream by adding some allulose sugar so they are sweet and caramelly like waffle cones, but zero net carbs.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Goecke

customer_reviews.title: Nothing that was tried came out satisfactorily. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to give this as a gift for a student. Just did not perform as was expected. Made a big mess and product was either too thin, or too hard. Just too messy.
customer_reviews.author: Lagabbi111

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Waffle Bowl Maker, so glad I bought one at the great price!!
customer_reviews.author: Doug W.

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard
customer_reviews.text: Fire Hazard!! Just used this today. Only had it since February. 2nd time using it. It has been unplugged for 3 hours now, but won't turn off. It is frickin hot. I'm about to put it in a sink of water. Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Dianna B Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Not as nifty as it looks.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the bowl to turn out like a crispy waffle. The bowls seemed kind of floppy and soggy. Very difficult to butter. I'll stick with the flat waffle irons going forward. The bowl is a nice size if you can find the right recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: Messy and too hot to touch but once you get the hang of the measurements (use slightly less batter than recommended) each waffle turns out better than the one before. Meh.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast food!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Quick and easy for the teens to use early morning. Or quick breakfast before school. We live ours!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my sister who loves making things from foods to crafts. She absolutely loved it, just trying to figure put the best way to use it

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Fun to Make
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy making waffle bowls. It comes with a recipe book too. I haven't put anything in them yet, but eat them as they are.
customer_reviews.author: Annie E. Schavelin

customer_reviews.title: Chaffle bowl maker!!
customer_reviews.text: We don’t eat gluten and have just learned about chaffles. This makes awesome chaffle bowls. Have only had it for a few days and we have made chaffle taco bowls and everyone loves them. No longer have to give up our bowls while still eating healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great for making tortilla bowls
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a stocking stuffer for my wife as a off the wall type selection and it was $15 on Cyber Monday. It actually works great! We use it to cook tortillas into bowls for various fillings. Very pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: cute and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: this was what i was expecting, I found the product simple to follow the instructions and the overall use was pretty straight forward, it cleaned up pretty easily as well. the waffle bowls do take a lot of practice to make nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Betsey Rolston

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: Still playing with the amount of batter to get just the right size bowl Don’t like the way it closes and pushes the batter out
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Bliss
customer_reviews.text: Easily the 15th best addition you can make to a kitchen that pretty much already has everything. Hash brown bowls are a highlight.

customer_reviews.title: No instructions/recipe book

customer_reviews.author: DietDrDew

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The mini waffle bowl maker is efficient, easy to use, easy to clean. Great value for the price. Extremely versatile. I used cookie dough, and the bowl was ideal for our ice cream social. No dishes to wash, plastic throw away spoons. Perfect.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.

customer_reviews.text: Use this a lot careful need to watch or it wil burn fast

customer_reviews.title: so much waffle goodness
customer_reviews.text: Make a waffle bowl for breakfast, fill with fruit and a dab of whipped cream. Blueberries or cherries. Make them early in the morning before the wife gets up so you don't have to share.

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Kids had a lot of fun making ice cream sundaes in waffle bowls. We plan on making breakfast waffle bowls also.

customer_reviews.title: Great for gatherings. Just leave it out and your visitors will do the rest. 😉
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun family and friendly item. Easy and quick. Our company during the holidays enjoyed this so much I ended up purchasing one for each family member. We leave it out on the counter during gatherings and whom ever wants an ice cream bowl makes one. Great product 👍

customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised and it has met my expectations!

customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Berg

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use love it!

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect waffle bowls, easily.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.

This morning I mixed defrosted tater tots and eggs and made couple bowls - tasty and I put grape tomatoes in the bowl. It’s a fun little fancy. I will try real savory waffle bowl with vegetables next. Sherrill

product_meta.title: DASH Waffle Bowl Maker: The Waffle Maker Machine for Individual Waffle Bowls, Belgian Waffles, Taco Bowls, Chicken & Waffles, other Sweet or Savory Treats - Aqua
product_meta.description: Color:AquaUse your DASH waffle bowl maker over and over again with nonstick plates that clean easily preserve the perfect waffle bowl shape. Whether you’re in the mood for a decadent sundae or a crispy taco shell, The DASH waffle bowl maker can do it all. Create your delicious, Instagram-worthy, treat with zero extra assembly. Simply plug in your waffle bowl maker and you’re practically ready to dig in.
feature_bullets: MORE THAN WAFFLES: Make waffle bowls for a sweet treat (ice cream sundaes, belgian waffle toppings, or even chicken & waffles). Want savory? Tortillas can be “waffled” into single serving taco bowls for a mess free supper!
COMPACT + LIGHTWEIGHT: Weighing 3lb+, this is a MUST-HAVE for that first apartment, smaller kitchen, college dorm life, or camper/RV traveling - Smores topped waffles?!
QUICK + EASY: Simply plug it in and go; it heats up in mere minutes. The dual non-stick surfaces provide an even cook for consistent results, each and every time

PERFECT GIFT: The perfect wedding or new home gift. Its small size takes up little counter space, and its sleek design and trendy color options will match any kitchen décor (add to your registry now!)
INCLUDES: Backed by a 1-year manufacturer warranty, the Dash Waffle Bowl Maker includes recipe book and recipe database access (all non-electric parts are easily wiped clean)
